Modules | Data Structures | Defines | Typedefs | Functions | Variables
Server

Modules

 NodeStore
 

Stores the nodes in the address space. Internally, it is based on a hash-map that maps nodes to their nodeid.


 Services
 

The UA services that can be called from a remote user.

Add a new namespace to the server. Returns the index of the new namespace.

void UA_Server_addNetworkLayer ( UA_Server *  server,
UA_ServerNetworkLayer  networkLayer 
)

Adds a network layer to the server. The network layer is destroyed together with the server. Do not use it after adding it as it might be moved around on the heap.

UA_StatusCode UA_Server_addRepeatedJob ( UA_Server *  server,
UA_Job  job,
UA_UInt32  interval,
UA_Guid *  jobId 
)
Parameters:
serverThe server object.
jobPointer to the job that shall be added. The pointer is not freed but copied to an internal representation.
intervalThe job shall be repeatedly executed with the given interval (in ms). The interval must be larger than 5ms. The first execution occurs at now() + interval at the latest.
jobIdSet to the guid of the repeated job. This can be used to cancel the job later on. If the pointer is null, the guid is not set.
Returns:
Upon success, UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD is returned. An error code otherwise.
UA_StatusCode UA_Server_addVariableNode ( UA_Server *  server,
const UA_NodeId  nodeId,
const UA_QualifiedName  browseName,
const UA_LocalizedText  displayName,
const UA_LocalizedText  description,
const UA_UInt32  userWriteMask,
const UA_UInt32  writeMask,
const UA_NodeId  parentNodeId,
const UA_NodeId  referenceTypeId,
UA_Variant *  value,
UA_NodeId *  createdNodeId 
)

A new variable Node with a value passed in variant.

Parameters:
serverThe server object
nodeIdThe requested nodeId of the new node. Use the numeric id with i=0 to get a new ID from the server.
browseNameThe qualified name of this node
displayNameThe localized text shown when displaying the node
descriptionThe localized human readable description
userWriteMaskBitmask defining the user write permissions
writeMaskBitmask defining the write permissions
parentNodeIdThe node under which this node exists ("parent")
referenceTypeIdReference type used by the parent to reference this node
valueA variant containing the value to be assigned to this node.
createdNodeIdPointer to a NULL pointer that will hold the copy of the nodeId on a successfull return.
Returns:
Return UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD if the node was created or an appropriate error code if not.

void UA_Server_delete ( UA_Server *  server)
UA_StatusCode UA_Server_deleteNode ( UA_Server *  server,
UA_NodeId  nodeId 
)

Deletes a node from the nodestore.

Parameters:
serverThe server object
nodeIdID of the node to be deleted
Returns:
Return UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD if the node was deleted or an appropriate errorcode if the node was not found or cannot be deleted.
UA_SERVER_DELETENODEALIAS_DECL ( Object  )

Deletes a copied instance of a node by deallocating it and all its attributes. This assumes that the node was priorly copied using getNodeCopy. To delete nodes that are located in the nodestore, use UA_Server_deleteNode() instead.

Parameters:
serverThe server object
nodeA copy of any node-type struct created with getNodeCopy; must *not* be managed by the nodestore.
Returns:
Return UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD if the node was deleted or an appropriate errorcode if the node was not found or cannot be deleted.
UA_StatusCode UA_Server_forEachChildNodeCall ( UA_Server *  server,
UA_NodeId  parentNodeId,
UA_NodeIteratorCallback  callback,
void *  handle 
)

Iterate over all nodes referenced by parentNodeId by calling the callback function for each child node

Parameters:
serverThe server object.
parentNodeIdThe NodeId of the parent whose references are to be iterated over
callbackThe function of type UA_NodeIteratorCallback to be called for each referenced child
Returns:
Upon success, UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD is returned. An error code otherwise.
UA_StatusCode UA_Server_getAttributeValue ( UA_Server *  server,
UA_NodeId  nodeId,
UA_AttributeId  attributeId,
void **  value 
)
UA_Logger UA_Server_getLogger ( UA_Server *  server)
UA_StatusCode UA_Server_getNodeCopy ( UA_Server *  server,
UA_NodeId  nodeId,
void **  copyInto 
)

Creates a deep copy of a node located in the nodestore and returns it to the userspace. Note that any manipulation of this copied node is not reflected by the server, but otherwise not accessible attributes of the node's struct can be examined in bulk. node->nodeClass can be used to cast the node to a specific node type. Use UA_Server_deleteNodeCopy() to deallocate this node.

Parameters:
serverThe server object
nodeIdID of the node copy to be copied
copyIntoPointer to a NULL pointer that will hold the copy of the node on a successfull return.
Returns:
Return UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD if the node was copied or an appropriate errorcode if the node was not found or cannot be copied.
UA_Server* UA_Server_new ( UA_ServerConfig  config)
UA_StatusCode UA_Server_removeRepeatedJob ( UA_Server *  server,
UA_Guid  jobId 
)

Remove repeated job. The entry will be removed asynchronously during the next iteration of the server main loop.

Parameters:
serverThe server object.
jobIdThe id of the job that shall be removed.
Returns:
Upon sucess, UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD is returned. An error code otherwise.
UA_StatusCode UA_Server_run ( UA_Server *  server,
UA_UInt16  nThreads,
UA_Boolean *  running 
)

Runs the main loop of the server. In each iteration, this calls into the networklayers to see if jobs have arrived and checks if repeated jobs need to be triggered.

Parameters:
serverThe server object
nThreadsThe number of worker threads. Is ignored if MULTITHREADING is not activated.
runningPoints to a boolean value on the heap. When running is set to false, the worker threads and the main loop close and the server is shut down.
Returns:
Indicates whether the server shut down cleanly
UA_StatusCode UA_Server_run_mainloop ( UA_Server *  server,
UA_Boolean *  running 
)
